label: ABC2_hR4_166_a_b_c-004
title: Rhombohedral Delafossite (CuFeO$_{2}$) Structure
comments:
Delafossite appears in two forms which differ in the stacking of the layers: rhombohedral, shown here, and \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_hP8_194_a_c_f-005}{hexagonal, prototype CuAlO$_{2}$}.  Most of the structures found in the hexagonal phase can also be found in the rhombohedral structure (Marquardt, 2006). 
 Rhombohedral delafossite has the same AFLOW label, ABC2\_hR4\_166\_a\_b\_c, as \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_hR4_166_a_b_c-001}{caswellsilverite CrNaS$_{2}$, $F5_{1}$}, \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_hR4_166_a_b_c-009}{$\alpha$-NaFeO$_{2}$} and \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_hR4_166_a_b_c-010}{LiNiO$_{2}$}. 
 The difference in the internal parameter $z_{3}$ between CuFeO$_{2}$ and CrNaS$_{2}$ causes a large change in the bonding of the two crystals, so we present them as different structures. 
 The structures are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files. 
 Hexagonal settings of this structure can be obtained with the option {\tt --hex}.
